channel.title: Factional Endscreens
channel.description:
Here is my suggestion when a faction wins, show some ending art
Ideas:
Blue Dragon: Everyone is sitting around the table laughing, drinking and having a good time, the Priest is blessing the drink or something and the Knight is hanging up his sword and making his way toward the party
Unseen: Castle Adiart is seen from the exterior surrounded by black rose flowers and flying the banner of the Unseen, the Mastermind and Assassin are walking away from the entrance, signifying that they are going off to conquer the next castle
Cult: Once again Castle Adiart is seen from the exterior, this time drenched in the shadow cast by a giant-sized Corax, Mithras(also giant) has a handful of helpless Blue Dragon members and is pulling them towards his open mouth, the Cult Leader is seen laughing evilly atop the castle's battlements
Neutrals:
Possessor: The Good King is seen, surrounded by the Possessor's glow, grinning maniacally and drinking wine surrounded by dead Blue Dragon classes
Reaper: The Reaper sits on a throne of skulls, his hood down revealing his spoopy head wearing a crown
Alchemist(Solo): The Alchemist is seen brewing a cauldron of Crimson Potion in her night room
Fool(Solo): Rain falls over a gravestone that simply states "rest in peace", we see a happy fool in the background, transparent because he's a ghost
Mercenary(Solo): A shadowy figure hands the Mercenary a large sack of coins
Scorned(Solo): A rough sketch of one of the BD classes is shown painted over with a big red X, the X should be blood for extra effect
Neutral King(Solo): The King is seen on his throne with his head in his hands as several classes are shown dead
Over each art it would say "[Faction/s] Win", perhaps in a different font for each faction

item.title: Factional Endscreens
item.dc:creator: Insanity
item.description:
fucking

*Tarnation

item.title: Factional Endscreens
item.dc:creator: RopeStringFace
item.description: Read full topic

item.title: Factional Endscreens
item.dc:creator: Jazz
item.description:
Look

They leave with 2 because they start with 2

If this idea is ever picked up and the artists want to draw more than 2, that’s fine

But I’m not changing my fucking suggestion so drop it

Read full topic

item.title: Factional Endscreens
item.dc:creator: RopeStringFace
item.description:
Who said they would arrive at the same time or claim to be friends?

Unseen can be smarter than that.

Read full topic

item.title: Factional Endscreens
item.dc:creator: Icibalus
item.description:
No, I think the idea is that if 3 people all turned up claiming to be friends it wouldn’t work.
Plus, you can’t plan for which classes get converted. I like the Unseen winscreen.

Read full topic

item.title: Factional Endscreens
item.dc:creator: RopeStringFace
item.description:
Yeah, I mean take one other…

Read full topic

item.title: Factional Endscreens
item.dc:creator: Jazz
item.description:
Well maybe the Mastermind doesn’t like the rest of the unseen

I don’t know it would just look nicer than sixteen evil people walking out at once

You’ve got to leave enough to run the castle

Read full topic

item.title: Factional Endscreens
item.dc:creator: RopeStringFace
item.description:
JammySplodge:

Because they start at the next castle with only MM and Assassin it kinda makes sense in terms of the game mechanics y’know

Why would they leave alone, if they have more allies to bring? I assume that this was their first castle conquest, that is why they have 2 only.

Read full topic

item.title: Factional Endscreens
item.dc:creator: Jazz
item.description:
RopeStringFace:

Why would they leave alone?

Because they start at the next castle with only MM and Assassin it kinda makes sense in terms of the game mechanics y’know

XBlade what do you think of my ideas

hm, did xed just used 7-8 hrs to draw this.

item.title: Factional Endscreens
item.dc:creator: ThePlex
item.description:
I would have sort of imagined the Cult to build a statue to Mithras right in the middle of the Throne Room

Read full topic

item.title: Factional Endscreens
item.dc:creator: Icibalus
item.description:
Erm… not what we had in mind but good enough!

Read full topic

item.title: Factional Endscreens
item.dc:creator: í42-Xblade
item.description:
ThePlex:

Also, why would Cult throw a party?


(art by Xed)

Read full topic

item.title: Factional Endscreens
item.dc:creator: Icibalus
item.description:
The whole point is the Scorned just crossed them off their revenge list.
Plus, you don’t have to say ‘agree’ on every one you agree with. Just S=say: I agree with everything on htis list, except for these:

Read full topic

item.title: Factional Endscreens
item.dc:creator: ThePlex
item.description:
Norm, Jammy got it spot on. I agree with all the points she made.

First off “A Victory party is throne” - someone who likes to correct spelling, you should at least get it right yourself. Also, why would Cult throw a party?

Second, why would there be a noose at all? Nobody in this game is being hung.

Read full topic

item.title: Factional Endscreens
item.dc:creator: RopeStringFace
item.description:
JammySplodge:

Blue Dragon: Everyone is sitting around the table laughing, drinking and having a good time, the Priest is blessing the drink or something and the Knight is hanging up his sword and making his way toward the party

Yes

JammySplodge:

Unseen: Castle Adiart is seen from the exterior surrounded by black rose flowers and flying the banner of the Unseen, the Mastermind and Assassin are walking away from the entrance, signifying that they are going off to conquer the next castle

Why would they leave alone?

JammySplodge:

Cult: Once again Castle Adiart is seen from the exterior, this time drenched in the shadow cast by a giant-sized Corax, Mithras(also giant) has a handful of helpless Blue Dragon members and is pulling them towards his open mouth, the Cult Leader is seen laughing evilly atop the castle’s battlements

Disagree.

A victory party is throne, with the prince being tortured atop a cross behind the cult leader’s throne. The invoker is serving red (presumably blood) wine to him, and other cult members are doing miscellaneous actions.

JammySplodge:

Possessor: The Good King is seen, surrounded by the Possessor’s glow, grinning maniacally and drinking wine surrounded by dead Blue Dragon classes

agree

JammySplodge:

Reaper: The Reaper sits on a throne of skulls, his hood down revealing his spoopy head wearing a crown

Disagree.

The reaper sits in his room, staring at a ball of souls, which is filled to the brim.

JammySplodge:

Alchemist(Solo): The Alchemist is seen brewing a cauldron of Crimson Potion in her night room

Should be the emerald potion

JammySplodge:

Mercenary(Solo): A shadowy figure hands the Mercenary a large sack of coins

agreed

JammySplodge:

Scorned(Solo): A rough sketch of one of the BD classes is shown painted over with a big red X, the X should be blood for extra effect

Disagree.

One of the BD classes is shown, with a noose around their neck.

JammySplodge:

Neutral King(Solo): The King is seen on his throne with his head in his hands as several classes are shown dead

agree

Read full topic

item.title: Factional Endscreens
item.dc:creator: Jazz
item.description:
and the fact that they’re very rare could make them a talking point

or a competitions for who can get the screen first

Read full topic

item.description:
True.

or

one merc on another merc that lost

item.title: Factional Endscreens
item.dc:creator: Ashe
item.description:
Mercenary can’t win solo though, right? Whoever their target’s faction is will win with them. Otherwise, really awesome suggestions.

Read full topic

item.description:
This would be really cool to add at some point!
